ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Overthere to Oasis
ygData.msgSnippet: Some of us were actually hoping to see some deity related items that aren t Innouruk specific.  I would think a fair number of bards actually chose a deity for
ygData.messageBody:
Some of us were actually hoping to see some deity related items that aren't
Innouruk specific. I would think a fair number of bards actually chose a
deity for reasons other than convenience. Well, one can hope anyhow.

Kit

hehehe SHH don't remind em ;)

> IIRC, Verant stated before Kunark was released that some of the new magic
> items that would be found in Kunark would be deity specific. Guess they
> decided not to implement the idea.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 23, 2000 5:39 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Overthere to Oasis
>
>
> Jamie Furtner wrote:
>
> > If you are agonistic or a worshipper of Bristlebane, and have never
taken
> a
> > VentrilSavil faction hit, you should be fine.
>
> Can anyone tell me if there is any advantage to being anything other than
> agnostic for most classes? I
> picked one of the Marrs back in April '99, and it's pretty annoying that
> both the Mask of Deception and
> the Iksar Hide Mask are, essentially, utterly worthless as a consequence.
> I'm a Half Elf, I don't need
> the vision stuff.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 51 songs, Innoruuk
>
